text:
This diagram outlines three distinct cortico-basal ganglia-thalamocortical loops:

1.  **Body Movement Loop:** Involves motor, premotor, and somatosensory cortices, the putamen, specific globus pallidus segments, and ventral lateral/anterior thalamic nuclei, projecting back to motor/premotor cortex.
2.  **Prefrontal Loop:** Connects the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex, anterior caudate, globus pallidus/substantia nigra pars reticulata, and mediodorsal/ventral anterior thalamic nuclei, returning to the dorsolateral prefrontal cortex.
3.  **Limbic Loop:** Links limbic/frontal cortical areas (anterior cingulate, orbitofrontal, amygdala, hippocampus, temporal), the ventral striatum (nucleus accumbens), ventral pallidum, and mediodorsal thalamic nucleus, looping back to these limbic/frontal regions.

Essentially, it details how the frontal cortex uses specific basal ganglia-thalamic circuits for motor control, executive functions, and emotional/motivational processing.
